qas.question: How many MRAP vehicles has the Pentagon bought since 2007?
How many of the 25,000 vehicles do they plan on getting rid of?
How many of the vehicles will be used for training?
The Army will be keeping 5,681 of what vehicle?
What type of ambulance will the Army have 301 of?
How many MRAP vehicles has the pentagon bought since 2000?
How many of the 25,00 vehicles does they plan on selling?
How many vehicles does the Army plan on not using for training?
How many vehicles will the Navy be keeping?
What type of tank will the the Army have 301 of?

context: The Pentagon bought <a0_0><b5_0>25,000<b5_0/><a0_0/> MRAP vehicles since 2007 in 25 variants through rapid acquisition with no long-term plans for the platforms. The Army plans to divest <a1_0><b6_0>7,456<b6_0/><a1_0/> vehicles and retain <b8_0>8,585<b8_0/>. Of the total number of vehicles the Army will keep, 5,036 will be put in storage, <a2_0><b7_0>1,073<b7_0/><a2_0/> will be used for training, and the remainder will be spread across the active force. The <a3_0>Oshkosh M-ATV<a3_0/> will be kept the most at 5,681 vehicles, as it is smaller and lighter than other MRAPs for off-road mobility. The other most retained vehicle will be the Navistar MaxxPro Dash with 2,633 vehicles, plus 301 <a4_0><b9_0>Maxxpro<b9_0/><a4_0/> ambulances. Thousands of other MRAPs like the Cougar, BAE Caiman, and larger MaxxPros will be disposed of.
